SENT.plain: A 20-year-old man of Marfan's syndrome who had mitral valve regurgitation, annuloaortic ectasia with aortic valve regurgitation and aortic arch aneurysm was successfully treated with radical operation
Mitral valve replacement was performed with superior wall incision of the left atrium directly
Complete transection of the aortic root made it easy to reach the mitral valve
The diameter of his ascending aorta was 70 mm, and modified Bentall' procedure, Carrel patch method, was performed
Aortic arch was 40 mm in diameter, and total aortic arch replacement was performed under hypothermic circulatory arrest
After the combined operation, patient was recovered uneventfully
